title: Mini CHARLOTTE
description: I designed this robot using the CHARLOTTE robot as a reference. The original CHARLOTTE was made for the NASA Big Idea Competition in 2022, and won the Systems Engineering Award. Mini CHARLOTTE is fully 3D-printed, uses a Raspberri Pi and 12 Robotis motors to control the 3 3DOF legs, and the 3 1DOF legs.

title: ESP32 Websocket Car
description: I designed this car that hosts a website on the ESP32. The website allows you to control the car using a keyboard on any device on the same network.

title: Gravitational Physics Simulation
description: A JavaFX simulation modeling orbital physics using Newton's law of gravitation and 3D vector math. I used object-oriented design and built visual representations of 3D vectors using cylinder-cone models, applying concepts from calculus and physics.

title: Abstract Wave Art
description: Inspired by water caustics and wave patterns. This Python project layers and rotates mathematical waveforms (e^sin(x)) to generate intricate light-shadow maps. I used cv2 for rotation, optimized performance, and shared the generative art via an Instagram page.

title: SabL-Cesium
description: A conceptual system of universal measurement units not based on Earth-centric standards like the second or meter. Built from a conversation about how units should be derived from universal constants instead of arbitrary Earth measurements.

title: 5WikiFacts AI Video Project
description: An automated pipeline that generated short videos summarizing Wikipedia articles into 5 facts. Used ChatGPT, Wikipedia API, Google Images, Amazon TTS, and OpenCV to compile videos and upload to YouTube Shorts. Gained 70+ subs and 19K+ views.

title: MNIST Neural Network
description: My first dive into machine learning. Wrote a neural network from scratch to classify hand-drawn digits using the MNIST dataset. Focused on understanding the fundamentals of forward propagation and backpropagation.

title: Bezier Curve Swerve Paths
description: A tool to generate smooth autonomous paths for our FIRST Robotics team's swerve drive using Bezier curves. Helped us win the Autonomous Award at the Arizona East 2023 Regional.

title: Isometric Game
description: An ongoing project inspired by Polytopia, SimCity, and Civ VI. Built both 2D and isometric prototypes, implemented pathfinding and world saving. I plan to restart the project in C++ with better architecture and devlogs.
